title: 111_hr2285
content: The Act titled "Vehicle Efficiency Heightening Investment Credit to Lift our Economy Act of 2009" introduces a new section 45R for fleet vehicles in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Act "Vehicle Efficiency Heightening Investment Credit to Lift our Economy Act of 2009" introduces a new section 45R in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, allowing a tax credit for fleet vehicles based on specific criteria such as fuel economy and assembly location. The credit amount is $4,000 for eligible fleet vehicles placed in service during the taxable year. The Act "Vehicle Efficiency Heightening Investment Credit to Lift our Economy Act of 2009" introduces a new section 45R in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, allowing a tax credit for fleet vehicles based on specific criteria such as fuel economy and assembly location. The credit amount is $4,000 for eligible fleet vehicles placed in service during the taxable year. The tax credit amount increases to $5,000 for fleet vehicles meeting certain fuel economy and assembly location requirements. The Act "Vehicle Efficiency Heightening Investment Credit to Lift our Economy Act of 2009" introduces a new section 45R in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, allowing a tax credit for fleet vehicles based on specific criteria such as fuel economy and assembly location. The credit amount is $4,000 for eligible fleet vehicles placed in service during the taxable year, increasing to $5,000 for those meeting certain fuel economy and assembly location requirements. The tax credit is limited to 15 fleet vehicles per taxable year. Definitions for fleet vehicles under the new section 45R include criteria such as being a passenger automobile, nonpassenger automobile, or work truck, acquired for use by the taxpayer, subject to depreciation, and made by a manufacturer. The terms 'automobile', 'passenger automobile', and 'work truck' are defined in section 32901(a) of title 49, United States Code. The term 'nonpassenger automobile' refers to a light truck not classified as a work truck. 'Highway label fuel economy value' is the miles per gallon number displayed on a new automobile label. 'Motor vehicle' is defined as a vehicle with at least 4 wheels primarily for use on public streets, roads, and highways. The term 'related person' is defined as a person who bears a specified relationship to another person or is engaged in trades or business under common control. The section provides rules for the reduction in basis of property for which a credit is allowable under subsection (a). It also states that the section does not apply to property purchased after December 31, 2010. Additionally, it amends Section 38(b) to include the credit as part of the business credit. The amendment adds a fleet vehicle credit under section 45R(a) and adjusts the basis in Section 1016(a) by adding paragraph (38) related to section 45R(d)(2). Conforming amendments are made to the table of sections. The fleet vehicle credit under section 45R applies to property placed in service after December 31, 2008.
